meanings.definition: To cause injury to (a part of the body) again.
meanings.sent1: After falling, he risked reinjuring his ankle.
meanings.sent2: She was careful not to reinjure her wrist while playing sports.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy cat kept reinjuring its tail on the furniture.
meanings.sent4: His careless actions led to reinjuring old wounds.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's fear of reinjuring his knee affected his performance.

meanings.definition: To sustain an injury to (a part of the body) that had previously been injured.
meanings.sent1: By not resting, he ended up reinjuring his shoulder.
meanings.sent2: The dancer was devastated to reinjure her knee during practice.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful hiker kept reinjuring his sprained ankle on the trail.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like it was reinjuring with every painful memory.
meanings.sent5: The fragile bridge was at risk of reinjuring itself with each passing storm.
